member.name: Font.Clone
member.summary: The Font.Clone method creates a newFont object based on thisFont object.
member.returns: This method returns a pointer to the newFont object.

member.name: Font.Font
member.summary: Creates a Font.Font object based on a FontFamily object, a size, a font style, and a unit of measurement.
member.param: Pointer to a FontFamily object that specifies information such as the string that identifies the font family and the font family's text metrics measured in design units.
Real number that specifies the em size of the font measured in the units specified in theunit parameter.

Optional. Integer that specifies the style of the typeface. This value must be an element of the enumeration or the result of a bitwiseOR applied to two or more of these elements. For example, FontStyleBold | FontStyleUnderline | FontStyleStrikeout sets the style as a combination of the three styles. The default value is FontStyleRegular.
Optional. Element of the enumeration that specifies the unit of measurement for the font size. The default value is UnitPoint.

member.name: Font.Font
member.summary: Creates a Font.Font object based on a font family, a size, a font style, a unit of measurement, and aFontCollection object.
member.param: Name of the font family.
Real number that specifies the em size of the font measured in the units specified in theunit parameter.

Optional. Integer that specifies the style of the typeface. This value must be an element of the enumeration or the result of a bitwiseOR applied to two or more of these elements. For example, FontStyleBold | FontStyleUnderline | FontStyleStrikeout sets the style as a combination of the three styles. The default value is FontStyleRegular.
Optional. Element of the enumeration that specifies the unit of measurement for the font size. The default value is UnitPoint.
Optional. Pointer to aFontCollection object that specifies a user-defined group of fonts. If the value of this parameter is NULL, the system font collection is used. The default value is NULL.

member.name: Font.Font
member.summary: Creates a Font.Font object based on the Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) font object that is currently selected into a specified device context. This constructor is provided for compatibility with GDI.
member.param: Handle to a Windows device context that has a font selected. A handle is a number that Windows uses internally to reference an object.

member.name: Font.Font
member.summary: Creates a Font.Font object indirectly from a Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) logical font by using a handle to a GDI LOGFONT structure.
member.param: Handle to a Windows device context. A handle is a number that Windows uses internally to reference an object.
Handle to a logical font.

member.name: Font.Font
member.summary: Creates a Font.Font object directly from a Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) logical font. The GDI logical font is aLOGFONTA structure, which is the one-byte character version of a logical font. This constructor is provided for compatibility with GDI.
member.param: Handle to a Windows device context. A handle is a number that Windows uses internally to reference an object.
Pointer to aLOGFONTA structure variable that contains attributes of the font. TheLOGFONTA structure is the one-byte character version of the logical font.

member.name: Font.Font
member.summary: Creates a Font.Font object directly from a Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) logical font. The GDI logical font is aLOGFONTW structure, which is the wide character version of a logical font. This constructor is provided for compatibility with GDI.
member.param: Handle to a Windows device context. A handle is a number that Windows uses internally to reference an object.
Pointer to aLOGFONTW structure variable that contains attributes of the font. TheLOGFONTW structure is the wide character version of the logical font.

member.name: Font.GetFamily
member.summary: The Font.GetFamily method gets the font family on which this font is based.
member.param: Pointer to a FontFamily object that receives the font family.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Font.GetHeight
member.summary: The Font.GetHeight method gets the line spacing of this font in the current unit of a specified Graphics object. The line spacing is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text. Thus, the line spacing includes the blank space between lines along with the height of the character itself.
member.param: Pointer to a Graphics object whose unit and vertical resolution are used in the height calculation.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Font.GetHeight
member.summary: The Font.GetHeight method gets the line spacing, in pixels, of this font. The line spacing is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text. Thus, the line spacing includes the blank space between lines along with the height of the character itself.
member.param: Real number that specifies the vertical resolution, in dots per inch, of the device that displays the font.
member.returns: This method returns the line spacing of the font in pixels.

member.name: Font.GetLastStatus
member.summary: The Font.GetLastStatus method returns a value that indicates the nature of thisFont object's most recent method failure.

returns.para: The Font.GetLastStatus method returns an element of the enumeration.
If no methods invoked on thisFont object have failed, then Font.GetLastStatus returns Ok.
If at least one method invoked on thisFont object has failed, then Font.GetLastStatus returns a value that indicates the nature of the most recent failure.

member.name: Font.GetLogFontA
member.summary: The Font.GetLogFontA method uses aLOGFONTA structure to get the attributes of thisFont object.
member.param: Pointer to a Graphics object that contains attributes of the display device.
Pointer to aLOGFONTA structure variable that receives the font attributes.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Font.GetLogFontW
member.summary: The Font.GetLogFontW method uses aLOGFONTW structure to get the attributes of thisFont object.
member.param: Pointer to a Graphics object that contains attributes of the video display.
Pointer to aLOGFONTW structure variable that receives the font attributes.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Font.GetSize
member.summary: The Font.GetSize method returns the font size (commonly called the em size) of thisFont object. The size is in the units of thisFont object.
member.returns: The method returns the font size. The size is in the units of thisFont object.

member.name: Font.GetStyle
member.summary: The Font.GetStyle method gets the style of this font's typeface.
member.returns: This method returns a value that is an element of the enumeration or the result of a bitwiseOR applied to two or more elements of the FontStyle enumeration.

member.name: Font.GetUnit
member.summary: The Font.GetUnit method returns the unit of measure of thisFont object.
member.returns: This method returns one of the elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Font.IsAvailable
member.summary: The Font.IsAvailable method determines whether thisFont object was created successfully.
member.returns: If the font was constructed successfully, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.
